content:
I think the show did an excellent job of portraying Diana's struggles with the royal family and her marriage to Charles. It's clear that the writers did their research and consulted with people who were close to Diana to get the details right.

I particularly appreciated how the show highlighted the suffocating nature of royal protocol and the pressure Diana faced to conform to certain expectations. It's heartbreaking to see her try to navigate the complexities of royal life while also dealing with her own personal struggles.

As for parallels with other women, I definitely drew some connections. Diana's experiences with feeling trapped and silenced in her marriage, as well as her struggles with mental health, are sadly all too relatable for many women. It's a powerful reminder that even someone with Diana's privilege and status can still face these kinds of challenges.

Speaking of mental health, I've been listening to a lot of musical theatre soundtracks on my daily commute, and one song that really resonates with me is "Wait for It" from
